title: 2 Simple Ways to Find Your YouTube Channel URL

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. This is the icon of a red rectangle with a white triangle inside. YouTube is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . If you aren't already logged into your account, do so now.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It's at the bottom-right corner of the screen. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap View channel.
steps.content: Tap View channel . You can find this next to your profile picture.

steps.title: Tap More about this channel.
steps.content: Tap More about this channel . This is underneath your profile picture.

steps.title: View your URL.
steps.content: View your URL. You'll see your Handle URL underneath More info . To share it, tap the URL. Then, tap Copy to paste it elsewhere. If you're looking for your unique Channel URL, you'll need to log into YouTube using a web browser .

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser. You can use a mobile or desktop browser. If you aren't already logged in, click Sign in to do so now. If you're using a mobile browser, you may need to request to view the desktop site. This option can usually be found at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This is in the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click YouTube Studio.
steps.content: Click YouTube Studio . This is underneath Sign out . A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Customization.
steps.content: Click Customization . You can find this in the left panel. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find your Channel URL.
steps.content: Find your Channel URL. This is the standard URL that YouTube channels use. This contains a unique channel ID with numbers and letters. The URL can be found underneath the Channel URL header, below the Description box. Click the overlapping rectangles icon to quickly copy the link to your clipboard. Click the place you want to paste the URL, then right-click and select Paste .

steps.title: Find your Handle URL.
steps.content: Find your Handle URL. A Handle URL is automatically created when you change your handle. Your handle is the username followed by an @ , such as @handle . The URL can be found underneath the Handle header, below your current handle. This is also where you can change your channel name . Highlight the URL underneath the handle field. On a computer, right-click select Copy to copy the URL to your clipboard. On mobile, tap the selection, and then tap Copy to copy the URL to your clipboard.
